meanings.definition: The weight in pounds of a shipment or package.
meanings.sent1: The poundage of the parcel was 10 pounds.
meanings.sent2: The shipping cost is determined by the poundage of the items.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy poundage of groceries up the stairs was quite a workout.
meanings.sent4: The poundage of responsibility on his shoulders felt overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The poundage of the fish caught by the fishermen was impressive.

meanings.definition: A fee or charge based on weight.
meanings.sent1: The poundage for shipping the goods was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: The airline charges extra poundage for overweight luggage.
meanings.sent3: The poundage for exceeding the weight limit was a costly mistake.
meanings.sent4: The poundage for the excess baggage was a surprise to the traveler.
meanings.sent5: The poundage for the delivery service was clearly stated in the contract.

meanings.definition: The act of pounding or striking repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The rhythmic poundage of the drums filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The constant poundage of the hammer could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The poundage of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent4: The poundage of the boxer's fists was impressive in the match.
meanings.sent5: The poundage of the rain on the roof created a calming sound.
